article.description:
Erick Strickland scored a season-high 22 points and Vitaly Potapenko added 12 points and 12 rebounds to lead the
Boston Celtics to a 98-94 victory over the Indiana Pacers on
Wednesday night.
article.headline: Strickland Celtics' surprise scoring leader

images.name: Strickland_Erik 012302 inline
images.caption: When he wasn't busy playing defense on Indiana's Travis Best, Boston's Erick Strickland, right, led the Celtics in scoring with a season-high 22 points.

article.linkText: Celtics get rare back-to-back wins over Pacers
article.story:
BOSTON (AP) -- In one of the rarest of rarities, someone other than Paul Pierce or Antoine Walker led the Celtics in scoring. Erick Strickland scored a season-high 22 points and Vitaly Potapenko added 12 points and 12 rebounds to lead Boston to a 98-94 victory over the Indiana Pacers on Wednesday night. It was only the second time in the last 113 games that someone other than Walker or Pierce led the Celtics in scoring. "That's a weapon we have," Walker said. "If we can continue to get those contributions from the bench, that will free things up for me and Paul." The Celtics, who improved to 7-25 against Indiana over the last 32 games, beat Indiana two consecutive times for the first time since the 1988-89 season. "They had a balanced attack and Boston is toughest when everybody gets involved," Reggie Miller said. "We made big shots and big stops, but we have to execute better down the stretch." Kenny Anderson and Potapenko scored the final 11 points of the game for Boston over the last 8:45. Anderson had 17 points and eight assists. Pierce was playing with a bad knee and wrist, while Tony Battie played with a hip pointer. Trailing 96-91, the Pacers missed three shots in the last 31 seconds before Strickland stole Travis Best's inbounds pass to seal the victory. "We killed ourselves tonight," Jermaine O'Neal said. "We had five or six opportunities in the fourth quarter to take the lead or tie the game, but we couldn't hit the shots." Jalen Rose scored five consecutive points to pull the Pacers to 92-91 with two minutes remaining. With the Pacers trailing 67-60, Miller scored 11 consecutive points for Indiana and pulled the Pacers to 74-71. Miller had 20 points in the third quarter and 26 overall. "I was surprised that Indiana went away from Miller in the fourth quarter," Celtics coach Jim O'Brien said. "I think we had something to do with that and our bench did a super job for us tonight." Rose had 20 points and 10 rebounds, while O'Neal scored 19 and grabbed 12 boards for the Pacers. Rose is shooting 71-for-135 in his last eight games. The first half featured nine lead changes and six ties. Strickland led the way for the Celtics with 12 points and six rebounds, while O'Neal had 11 points and six boards for the Pacers. After the Celtics fell behind 7-2, coach Jim O'Brien picked up a technical and Boston responded with a 13-2 run. Pierce finished with 20 for Boston and Walker had 12 points, nine rebounds and six assists. Game notes
O'Neal returned to the Pacers lineup after missing four games with a hyperextended left knee. The Pacers were 1-3 during his absence. ... Celtics guard Kedrick Brown left the game in the first quarter with a sprained ankle. Brown was making his third start of the season and had a career-high 12 points Monday against Toronto. ... Jamaal Tinsley began the night tied for third in the NBA with 9.1 assists a game. He had four assists and five turnovers and did not score. ... Pierce and Allen Iverson are tied for the NBA lead with 18 games of 30-plus points. ... The Celtics play Philadelphia at home on Friday. They have lost seven in a row to the Sixers.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
